Miwa’s algorithm and Genz & Bretz’ algorithm for
this situation are compared in Table
Miwa’s algorithm is a numerical method which
has advantages in achieving higher accuracy with
less time consumption compared to the stochastic
method. However, Miwa’s algorithm has some dis-
advantages. When the dimension m increases, the
time consumption of Miwa’s algorithm increases
dramatically. Moreover, it can not be applied to sin-
gular problems which are common in multiple test-
We have implemented an R interface to the proce-
For small dimensions, it is an alternative to quasi-
randomized Monte-Carlo procedures which are used
by default. For larger dimensions and especially for
singular problems, the method is not applicable.
